title: SpaceX receives launch license for second integrated flight test of Starship
summary: SpaceX has received the modified license No. VOL 23-129 Rev. 1, which will allow them to fly its Starship-Super Heavy vehicle for the second time. This came shortly after the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service (FWS) confirmed the completion of their investigation into the new deluge system at the orbital launch site in Starbase.

title: SpaceX lands FAA license for 2nd Starship launch
summary: Today, SpaceX was officially given the approval from the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) and the Fish and Wildlife Service to move ahead...

title: AST SpaceMobile adjusts launch plan for potential direct-to-device customer
summary: AST SpaceMobile is paying SpaceX $5 million more to launch its first commercial direct-to-smartphone satellites early next year to a different orbital inclination to improve coverage for a potential customer.

title: Rocket Factory Augsburg perceives historic moment for European launch industry
summary: Startup Rocket Factory Augsburg perceive an historic shift has occurred in Europe launch, just as the firm closes in on its first orbital launch attempt.

title: Space companies say ASAT tests threaten economic development
summary: "I'm hoping that more companies will be able to join as time goes on."
